## SAMPLERS

::: {.columns style="align-items: flex-start; column-gap: 3rem;"}

::: {.column width="45%" style="text-align: center;"}
### RoCSI

The **Robotic Cartridge Sampling Instrument**  
eDNA sampler developed at NOC  
Commercialised by McLane since the end of 2023  
Mesh size: **0.22 μm** (*sterivex* filters)

![](Figures/RoCSI.png){fig-alt="RoCSI sampler" width=85%}
:::

::: {.column width="55%" style="text-align: center;"}
### CPR

The **Continuous Plankton Recorder**  
In use since 1931  
Operated by the Marine Biological Association  
Mesh size: ~**270 μm**, Depth ~ **10 m**

::: {.columns}
::: {.column width="70%" style="text-align: center;"}

## Nutrients and Chlorophyll

Surface distribution of chlorophyll and dissolved inorganic nutrients along the cruise transects. Chlorophyll is shown as the CPR chlorophyll index derived from Continuous Plankton Recorder samples. Nutrient concentrations (nitrate, silicate, and phosphate) were measured from underway seawater sampling and analysed using a Seal QuAAtro39 AutoAnalyzer.

## Satelite data

MODIS Aqua 8-day composite chlorophyll-a concentration (mg m⁻³) providing satellite context for each of the four cruise transects. Red markers indicate sampling locations along each transect. Composites correspond to the period encompassing each transect to minimise data gaps due to cloud cover.
